definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The threat of financial mercantilism can be overstated.
sentences.chinese: 金融重商主義的危害也許有點危言聳聽。

sentences.english: Over time, China will move away from mercantilism.
sentences.chinese: 長期而言，中國終將會脫離重商主義。

sentences.english: But depreciation is also at least partially blocked by the Asian mercantilists.
sentences.chinese: 但是，貶值又至少部分地被亞洲重商主義者阻礙。

sentences.english: The US is entitled to protect itself against such mercantilism.
sentences.chinese: 在這種重商主義面前，美國有權保護自己。

sentences.english: The primary aim of mercantilists was to achieve power and wealth for the state.
sentences.chinese: 重商主義者的首要目的是爲了富強國家。

sentences.english: Mercantilism period is sex of capitalist production plan set sth afoot period.
sentences.chinese: 重商主義時期是資本主義生產計劃性的發軔期。

sentences.english: At closer range, it more closely resembles mercantilism.
sentences.chinese: 更切近點說，這看起來更像重商主義。

sentences.english: They seem to glory in their reputation for crass commercialism.
sentences.chinese: 他們彷彿以他們的愚鈍的重商主義名聲爲自豪。

sentences.english: The two are intrinsically mixed in the midst of modern commercialism and attached to.
sentences.chinese: 二者在現代重商主義中，很自然地融合在一起。

sentences.english: I’ve been writing about neomercantilism and China now for almost five years.
sentences.chinese: 將近五年前我曾寫過關於新重商主義和中國的文章。
